page.title: 18News-Local Events in Wooler
page.content: Events mentioned in the two local papers during one week in June 1985. Pupils from Glendale Middle School visited Alnwick to present HRH Princess Anne with a cheque for Â£64. This made a total of Â£765 donated to Save the Children Fund in 1985,to help the starving people in Africa. Parked lorries are posing a safety hazard to pedestrians and motorists who must cross a main road junction near Wooler.The lorries restrict visi- bility from the Peth along South Road. Wooler bus driver John Hodge has retired after 46 years service with the United Automobile Company. The retirement of Mr.&Mrs.M.Heckles has meant the end of a 150 year busin- ess link.The building firm of George Beattie had been part of the community since 1835.
